sentence.Network_en: The way Swedes integrate immigrants is, she feels, 100% more advanced.
sentence.Network_cn: 她觉得瑞典人帮助移民适应当地生活的方式百分百地更为先进。

sentence.Network_en: Encouraging teacher transfer would not, by itself, integrate the teaching corps.
sentence.Network_cn: 鼓励教师调动本身不会消弭教学队伍中的种族隔离。

sentence.Network_en: Little attempt was made to integrate the parts into a coherent whole.
sentence.Network_cn: 在把各部分结合成一个连贯的整体方面几乎未作任何尝试。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from Latin integrat- 'made whole', from the verb integrare, from integer 'whole' (see integer). Compare with integral and integrity

entry.def: If someone integrates into a social group, or is integrated into it, they behave in such a way that they become part of the group or are accepted into it.

example.ex: He didn't integrate successfully into the Italian way of life...
example.tran: 他没有顺利地融入到意大利的生活方式中。

example.ex: Integrating the kids with the community, finding them a role, is essential...
example.tran: 使孩子融入社区并为他们找到某个角色非常必要。

entry.tran: (使)(种族)融合;使取消种族隔离
entry.def: When races integrate or when schools and organizations are integrated, people who are black or belong to ethnic minorities can join white people in their schools and organizations.

example.ex: Schools came to us because they wanted to integrate...
example.tran: 学校来向我们寻求帮助是因为他们想让不同种族的学生得到平等待遇。

example.ex: Encouraging teacher transfer would not, by itself, integrate the teaching corps.
example.tran: 鼓励教师调动本身不会消弭教学队伍中的种族隔离。

entry.tran: (使)(与…)成为一体;(使)结合;(使)合并
entry.def: If you integrate one thing with another, or one thing integrates with another, the two things become closely linked or form part of a whole idea or system. You can also say that two things integrate .

example.ex: Integrating the pound with other European currencies could cause difficulties...
example.tran: 把英镑与欧洲其他货币合并会引发许多难题。

example.ex: Ann wanted the conservatory to integrate with the kitchen...
example.tran: 安想把温室与厨房打通。

means.word_mean: 1. make into a whole or make part of a whole;

sentences.sentence: "She incorporated his suggestions into her proposal"

means.word_mean: 2. open (a place) to members of all races and ethnic groups;

sentences.sentence: "The students at this school integrate immediately, despite their different backgrounds"

means.word_mean: 4. calculate the integral of; calculate by integration

stems_affixes.value_cn: 构成整体所必需的;完整的
stems_affixes.word_buile: integr完整+al……的→adj.构成整体所必需的;完整的
integrate[v.[into,with][使]成为一体,[使]结合在一起]+ion表名词→n.综合
integr完整+ity表名词→n.正直,诚实;完整,完全
dis分开+integrate成为一体→v.分裂成小片,瓦解
integr完整+ate使……→v.[into,with][使]成为一体,[使]结合在一起

Sentence.sentence: Sweden has gone farther than any other nation on earth to integrate the sexes and to offer women the same opportunities and freedoms as men.

Perhaps most significant, according to Mannaz, is the increasing interest large companies have in more collaborative management models, such as those prevalent in Scandinavia, which seek to integrate the hard and soft aspects of leadership and encourage delegated responsibility and accountability.

sentences.en: The committee can integrate the different plans.
sentences.cn: 委员会能够把几个计划合而为一。

sentences.en: They have lived in this country for ten years, but have never really integrated.
sentences.cn: 他们已在这个国家生活了十年, 但还没有融入这个社会。

sentences.en: Immigrants are integrated into the community.
sentences.cn: 移民与该地区的居民融为一体。

means.word_mean: 成为一体；结合在一起；合并

sentences.en: Do you really want to integrate with us?

jushi.english: They have lived in this country for ten years, but have never really integrated.
jushi.chinese: 他们已在这个国家生活了10年,但还没有与这个社会融为一体。

jushi.english: A customs union would integrate the economies of these countries.
jushi.chinese: 关税联盟会把这些国家的经济紧密结合在一起。

jushi.english: Some good suggestions will be able to integrate the plan.
jushi.chinese: 一些好的建议将能使这一计划更加完善。
